body: No title, no details. And all contents should be in English.

First of all, I am afraid v8 is not maintained anymore. Please upgrade to v9.

@kezhenxu94 Do you want to add anything for this exception?
4 files left for this PR? What happens?

> 4 files left for this PR? What happens?

I made a wrong push...
What is the current status of this PR?
Besides e2e, you should add UTs(Unit Tests) for your format transfer, it could cover more cases easily and help the reviewers to understand the codes.
The trace result being `18738897` (~18M) looks unreasonable to me, we can definitely increase the `maxContentLength` but that might not help to solve the real problem.
Are you collecting the parameters of the request? @xiao116134

I am not sure whether we have m1 support for the showcase. @Yemsheng At least, you should provide information rather than two error messages. 

> Just do with the document
https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-showcase/next/readme/

This doesn't make sense. You got the m1 to run locally, not us.

> 跟踪结果`18738897`（~18M）对我来说看起来不合理，我们肯定可以增加，`maxContentLength`但这可能无助于解决真正的问题。

I changed the ES maxContentLength to 500m, which is not good
So, what you are reporting? 500m is unreasonable in any case. You should check the data locally.
We don't even build Docker images for arm architecture, let alone m1 support.

OK, so, we don't support m1 and arm env in the showcase for now.

@Yemsheng If you want to, we are welcome to accept contributions.

@kezhenxu94 @wankai123 What do you think to do this breaking change?

One thing I think we should be concerned about is: such as k8s, this way will enable all metrics at the same time and no other choice. Some metrics need access to the API server. If that can be accepted, I'm OK with this.

> One thing I think we should be concerned about is: such as k8s, this way will enable all metrics at the same time and no other choice. Some metrics need access to the API server. If that can be accepted, I'm OK with this.

Maybe we can set k8s as two folders?
@yswdqz Do you think is it better to support the path pattern as well as use a file name? Such as `k8s/*.yaml` or `apisix/apisix.yaml`

> @yswdqz Do you think is it better to support the path pattern as well as use a file name? Such as `k8s/*.yaml` or `apisix/apisix.yaml`

That's a really good idea!

:warning: **6 God Classes** were detected by Lift in this project. [Visit the Lift web console](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/apache/skywalking/01GFTVW72SEX8QPCPSC7SSG83V?tab=technical-debt&utm_source=github.com&utm_campaign=lift-comment&utm_content=apache\%20skywalking) for more details.

> > @yswdqz Do you think is it better to support the path pattern as well as use a file name? Such as `k8s/*.yaml` or `apisix/apisix.yaml`
> 
> That's a really good idea!

One more compatibility we could add is, support ignore suffix(`.yaml`). Then a folder should be `/folder/*`, a file(`folder/mal.yaml`) should be either `folder/mal` or `folder/mal.yaml`. 
By this, we could support users' local configuration files placed and config in the old way.

> One more compatibility we could add is, support ignore suffix(`.yaml`). Then a folder should be `/folder/*`, a file(`folder/mal.yaml`) should be either `folder/mal` or `folder/mal.yaml`. By this, we could support users' local configuration files placed and config in the old way.

Maybe we should replace `/folder/*` as 'folder' so that old configuration can be support.
And we can judge file/folder by if there is a '/' in the string

> > One more compatibility we could add is, support ignore suffix(`.yaml`). Then a folder should be `/folder/*`, a file(`folder/mal.yaml`) should be either `folder/mal` or `folder/mal.yaml`. By this, we could support users' local configuration files placed and config in the old way.
> 
> Maybe we should replace `/folder/*` as 'folder' so that old configuration can be support. And we can judge file/folder by if there is a '/' in the string

That is not good practice. In typical setup, files in the folder should include `*` for files in the folder, and `**` represents files in the current and sub-folders.

> > > One more compatibility we could add is, support ignore suffix(`.yaml`). Then a folder should be `/folder/*`, a file(`folder/mal.yaml`) should be either `folder/mal` or `folder/mal.yaml`. By this, we could support users' local configuration files placed and config in the old way.
> > 
> > 
> > Maybe we should replace `/folder/*` as 'folder' so that old configuration can be support. And we can judge file/folder by if there is a '/' in the string
> 
> That is not good practice. In typical setup, files in the folder should include `*` for files in the folder, and `**` represents files in the current and sub-folders.

I understand. Should we support other pattern? Such as mysql/mysql*.yaml

* `/folder/*` should be from the root.
* `folder/*` represents `folder` in the current context
* `folder/file` represents a file or a folder. In our case, `folder` is illegal for our case. So, we treat this as a file, just add a default suffix(`.yaml`) by following we are doing for now.

> I understand. Should we support other pattern? Such as mysql/mysql*.yaml

If you want, we could add a utility in SkyWalking for further general use, but I think we don't have to. Your call.

> * `/folder/*` should be from the root.

Is the `root` means MAL 's root folder?

> > I understand. Should we support other pattern? Such as mysql/mysql*.yaml
> 
> If you want, we could add a utility in SkyWalking for further general use, but I think we don't have to. Your call.

I agree.

> > * `/folder/*` should be from the root.
> 
> Is the `root` means MAL 's root folder?

Actually, we don't have the root. Because we have declared all files should be `otel-rules`, the root and current context are the same.

> > > * `/folder/*` should be from the root.
> > 
> > 
> > Is the `root` means MAL 's root folder?
> 
> Actually, we don't have the root. Because we have declared all files should be `otel-rules`, the root and current context are the same.

We also have the `log-mal-rules` and `envoy-metrics-rules`
As I can see in this pull request, every folder only has a single file, even the exception one (k8s folder) we are considering to support activating one of them independently.

> As I can see in this pull request, every folder only has a single file, even the exception one (k8s folder) we are considering to support activating one of them independently.

Actually, there was an off-list discussion from https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9762
MySQL would become multiple files as instance files would be added from MAL analysis. 
I think the main reason for this, we are setting entity statements in expSuffix. So, once we need service and instance levels metrics at the same time, we usually use two files.

> expSuffix: tag({tags -> tags.cluster = 'istio-ctrl::' + tags.cluster}).service(['cluster', 'app'], Layer.MESH_CP)
@yswdqz you edited my comment and that makes me (and others) confused because I didn’t post that comment content and mine is gone.

> @yswdqz you edited my comment and that makes me (and others) confused because I didn’t post that comment content and mine is gone.

Sorry that is what I want to say ,I made a mistake And I don't know how to retract

> As I can see in this pull request, every folder only has a single file, even the exception one (k8s folder) we are considering to support activating one of them independently.

I need to change mysql.yaml to mysql-service.yaml and mysql-instance.yaml
Postgresql.yaml also has the same situation. So I send this pr.

The reason of these changes is about half of metrics should be instance level, and other metrics should be service level.
Without this change, we can only add level for each metric.
such as:
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/otel-rules/apisix.yaml

What is the question? My point is `/folder` and `folder` have no difference. The we only have one concept, root and current path are the same thing for MAL initialization, no matter in `otel-rules` or others

> What is the question? My point is `/folder` and `folder` have no difference. The we only have one concept, root and current path are the same thing for MAL initialization, no matter in `otel-rules` or others

I understand now. 
So we should support:
- `mysql/mysql-instance.yaml` : for file
- `mysql/mysql-instance` : the same as `mysql/mysql-instance.yaml`
- `/mysql/mysql-instance` : the same as `mysql/mysql-instance.yaml`
- `/mysql/mysql-instance.yaml` : the same as `mysql/mysql-instance.yaml`

- `/mysql/*.yaml` : for folder
- `/mysql/*` : the same as `/mysql/*.yaml`
- `mysql/*.yaml` : the same as `/mysql/*.yaml`
- `mysql/*` : the same as `/mysql/*.yaml`

Is it right? And maybe we should support `**` , too?
Do we really have case for deeper folder? I doubt that.

> Do we really have case for deeper folder? I doubt that.

For now we don't have it.
I understand. We can support it when we really need it.
Looking great! This is exactly what I need. Thank you!
I think it should be in general service dashboard as well?

> I think it should be in general service dashboard as well?

Yes, the Golang metrics panels have been put in General-Instance dashboard at all, we can enter the General-Instance dashboard from General-Service borad's instance tap, so the work you have mentioned is just done?
Sorry, my fault. Yes, they are in the general dashboard already.

> Sorry, my fault. Yes, they are in the general dashboard already.

That's all right, thanks for helping me check the things again.
Shall we consider deprecating Powermock and completely moving to Mockito

Thanks, that would be great.
Which component are you asking? UI, browser agent and Nodejs server agents are Node version relative.
And issue is only for issues having people working on. Otherwise, this should only be on discussion panel.
I think I had appoved, what changed?
Sorry, I made a wrong operation for requesting review from [wu-sheng](https://github.com/wu-sheng) and removed request for [arugal](https://github.com/arugal)

> Sorry, I made a wrong operation for requesting review from [wu-sheng](https://github.com/wu-sheng) and removed request for [arugal](https://github.com/arugal)

@wu-sheng @arugal
My appoval is still there I think. We are just blocked by CI.

> My appoval is still there I think. We are just blocked by CI.

Yes, I got it, thanks.

So this looks to be m1-specific as I tried Zulu 1.8, Zulu 11, and Temurin 1.8 Temurin 11 etc., all passed. One thing to note is that I can see the same logs (not even error logs) on Zulu 1.8 but all tests passed still.

I also faced this issue, so I do this to bypass it first

```ts
import agent from 'skywalking-backend-js'

 const agentInstance = has('default', agent)
      ? (agent.default as typeof agent)
      : agent

    agentInstance.start()
```
I guess so too. This test is definitely passed because CI/e2e had verified it.

@kezhenxu94 
Sorry I have not said clear. 
My idea was rejected here.
@wu-sheng I see all the e2e tests return failure, what could be causing this ?

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/3288941909

You could find logs from this page, at the bottom of the page. Most likely, the package of this branch can't boot up.

If AnalyzerModuleProvider needs the values in its configuration, how would you do?

> If AnalyzerModuleProvider needs the values in its configuration, how would you do?

You extend the `AnalyzerModuleProvider` (as `MyAnalyzerModuleProvider`) and you want the original `AnalyzerModuleProvider` to access the extended configuration?

The codes in AnalyzerModuleProvider are accessing, we have to copy all codes in AnalyzerModuleProvider to the new provider, which loses the point of inheritance. I know we have to do this before, I want to change the suitiation.

> > If AnalyzerModuleProvider needs the values in its configuration, how would you do?
> 
> 
> 
> You extend the `AnalyzerModuleProvider` (as `MyAnalyzerModuleProvider`) and you want the original `AnalyzerModuleProvider` to access the extended configuration? 

yes，when we need to invoke some super methods
OK, I get the point. Changing the config field to `protected` should also do the trick but that's not strictly enforced for new codes. The idea in this PR sounds good to me now.

> OK, I get the point. Changing the config field to `protected` should also do the trick but that's not strictly enforced for new codes. The idea in this PR sounds good to me now.

Yes, that works. But this can't be forced when we implement a new module and forget in the review process. So, I changed a lot to make we don't care `protected` or not.
Some tests fail, please recheck the changes.

@Team this looks like an interesting feature. I do have some knowledge on the kafka side, would love to contribute in any possible way
This is done in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9817

My current idea is to use `UnixDatagram` instead of `UnixStream`.

 As the document (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/unix.7.html) says:

> SOCK_DGRAM, for a datagram-oriented
>        socket that preserves message boundaries (as on most UNIX
>        implementations, UNIX domain datagram sockets are always reliable
>        and don't reorder datagrams)

But also have to solve the problem in mentioned in https://github.com/apache/skywalking-php/pull/15 for MacOS.

I've made a mistake (before). After digging into the code, I think the problem is not about `Datagram` or `Stream`. A 'pipe' is used as an mpsc channel for now. The actual problem is multi-process concurrent writing to the same pipe. A `Mutex` has no help with that or it would cause performance impact. IMHO, we may need to switch to `UnixListener` and I'm working on it.
I need to resolve the conflicts when I am back to my laptop

Indeed, in the case of large concurrency, multiple fpm worker processes or multiple swoole coroutines write data to the sender at the same time.

I think the solution is to use UnixDatagram which can determine the data boundary, carry the requested ID on the data packet, and then reassemble it at the receiver.

Could you recheck the document? I think we need some adjustment about the documents of metrics relative configurations - OTEL https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/opentelemetry-receiver/ - Meter https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/backend-meter/#configuration-file - Zabbix https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/backend-zabbix/ - Things to review on PR for telegraf https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9620 We are mentioning these as rule names, but it seems they are not anymore. At least they should be `rule pattern`, rather than `rule name`. @kezhenxu94 WDYT?

> Could you recheck the document? I think we need some adjustment about the documents of metrics relative configurations > > > > - OTEL https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/opentelemetry-receiver/ > > - Meter https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/backend-meter/#configuration-file > > - Zabbix https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/setup/backend/backend-zabbix/ > > - Things to review on PR for telegraf https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9620 > > > > We are mentioning these as rule names, but it seems they are not anymore. At least they should be `rule pattern`, rather than `rule name`. @kezhenxu94 WDYT? > > > > I think we can simply remove the Rule Name column because there is an existing column named Configuration File and users can compose a pattern to include that file.

I have confirmed, the satellite route ALS message is not fixed. I could do some updates on the satellite, but one thing I need to be confirmed. How can I get the service instance in the ALS Identifier(https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/api-v3/service/accesslog/v3/als.proto#envoy-v3-api-msg-service-accesslog-v3-streamaccesslogsmessage-identifier)?
@kezhenxu94 We need to follow that Envoy discussion, it seems a connection ID should be able to use to calculate rate/increasement.

> I have confirmed, the satellite route ALS message is not fixed. I could do some updates on the satellite, but one thing I need to be confirmed. How can I get the service instance in the ALS Identifier(https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/api-v3/service/accesslog/v3/als.proto#envoy-v3-api-msg-service-accesslog-v3-streamaccesslogsmessage-identifier)?

@kezhenxu94 I think we could use node ID?
This is ridiculous, upgrading the nacos version causes the packaging timeout without any reason, in CI, in my local, and in my codespace machine.
The new pom is confusing the maven?

> The new pom is confusing the maven?

I have no idea because the maven command just gets stuck without any useful message, even I turn on maven debug logs.
😂😂 I never used this kind of pom file. Let's feedback to Nacos team, this at least doesn't work for us.

There are two problems here: one is concurrent writing, and the other is blocking. `UnixDatagram` may solve the concurrent writing problem. Since we could not be sure that all data fit one write, we must multiplex the stream manually which could be tricky. On the other hand, busy writing to a non-blocking stream without retries almost always causes problems. IMHO, `UnixListener` and per fpm (side) threads solve each.
About the doc. I only found three places to use the loadRules method (otel-rules, log-mal-rules, envoy-metric-rules). So I think some docs needn't be modified.
I think we don't have to move so many real otel YAML files into the tests. The test files should be as simple as possible. Unless you are going to verify some expressions, your tests don't like so

> * Metrics in the TCP ALS are counters from the TCP connection established(confirmed by @wbpcode), so we need to build an incrementing mechanism compared to the last report(same pod), and then push the data into the sources for OAL engine.

What will be reported if a new connection is established, I think it doesn't contain the previous connections' metrics values, right? If that's the case, using node ID is not enough to build the incrementing mechanism, you have to know the connection ID as well
Like as usual, counter increase would restart, and statistics begin from 2nd round.

> Like as usual, counter increase would restart, and statistics begin from 2nd round.

In that case, we may also need something like connection ID.
Yes, that is being discussed on envoy PR.
